III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12404
Section • (2) Initial consideration must be given to placement with a
Description relative or placing siblings together, or both.
Violation Potential Rule or Statue Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that the agency did not give consideration of
placement of a child with a relative.
Investigation This investigation was initiated on 02/25/2025 with an email to
a DHHS District Manager requesting screen shot documentation
of text messages.
The agency Chief Administrator was informed of the
allegation via telephone on 03/04/2025. The Chief Administrator
reported that she was not aware of the allegation, and she did not
have knowledge of the concern noted in the allegation. Chief
Administrator referred to the agency Foster Care Supervisor for
information.
The agency Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed face to
face at the agency on 03/13/2025. Foster care Supervisor
reported she received an email from Foster Care Navigator on
01/15/2025 which stated there was a relative in North Carolina
who was interested in being a placement provider for Foster Child
A. Foster Care Supervisor reported she then contacted Relative 1
via phone on January 17, 2025. Foster Care Supervisor reported
she informed Relative 1 she would begin the process of
completing the ICPC packet and it would be done by early
February, 2025. Foster Care Supervisor reported she had begun
getting the packet forms together when the case was transferred
to DHHS in late January, 2025. Foster Care Supervisor was asked
if she had received any phone calls from Relative 1 in November
or December of 2024 and she denied that she had.
Relative 1 was interviewed on 04/28/2025 via telephone. A
previous attempt to contact Relative 1 occurred on 02/28/2025. A
voice mail message was left requesting a return call. Relative 1
reported she had called Samaritas agency in late December 2024
or early January 2025 as she was interested in the placement of
Foster Child A with her. Relative 1 reported she did not receive a
return call. Relative 1 was asked if she had a record of those
phone calls and she responded that she probably deleted them
but would look into it and forward evidence of the calls to this
2

consultant by 04/29/2025. Relative 1 reported she was in contact
with Foster Care Supervisor in mid-January 2025 at which time
the Foster Care Supervisor reported she would have the ICPC
packet completed by 02/07/2025. Relative 1 reported she and
Foster Care Supervisor had also communicated by text but
doubted that she would still have a record of the text. Relative 1
was asked to forward screen shots of the texts by 04/29/2025 if
she was able to locate them.
As of today’s date, 05/01/2025, no evidence of the calls or screen
shots have been received.
The Foster Care Navigator was interviewed via telephone on
04/28/2025. Foster Care Navigator reported on 01/15/2025 she
received a telephone call from Relative 1 who was interested in
the placement of Foster Child A with her in North Carolina. Foster
Care Navigator reported she then contacted Foster Care
Supervisor via email to inform her of the interest of Relative 1 in
having Foster Child A live with her. Foster Care Navigator
reported Foster Care Supervisor responded to her email on
01/16/2025 asking for more clarifying information.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
EMAILS: Emails between Foster Care Navigator and Foster Care
Supervisor dated 01/15/2025 and 01/16/2025 were reviewed. An
email dated 01/15/2025 from Foster Care Navigator informs the
Foster Care Supervisor of the interest expressed by Relative 1 of
placement of Foster Child A with her. An email dated 01/16/2025
from Foster Care Supervisor to Foster Care Navigator requests
additional information and her intention to telephone Relative 1.
TEXT Screen Shots: A text message dated 01/22/2025 from
Foster Care Supervisor to Relative 1 documents that Foster Care
Supervisor is wanting to update Relative 1 on progress towards
completing the ICPC packet. Foster Care Supervisor states the
packet is lengthy and she plans to have it completed by
02/07/2025. Relative 1 responds she cannot talk right now. A
01/23/2025 text from Foster Care Supervisor to Relative 1
documents that she is off next week but to text or email her for a
quicker response.
MISACWIS CASE FILE: A review of social work contacts
documents a 01/17/2025 contact, written by Foster Care
Supervisor, which documents that Foster Care Supervisor
contacted Relative 1.
3

The case file indicates that the case of Foster Child A was
transferred to Wayne County DHHS on 01/29/2025.
Analysis Relative 1 reported she had called the agency in late December
2024 or early January 2025 to inquire about being a placement for
Foster Child A. Foster Care Supervisor reported she had not
received a telephone call from Relative 1 in November or
December 2024 and her first contact with Relative 1 occurred on
01/17/2025.
There is no documented evidence of contact between Relative 1
and the Foster Care Supervisor or the agency prior 01/17/2025.
Once the Foster Care Supervisor learned of Relative 1’s interest
she was in contact with Relative 1 until the case was transferred
on 01/29/2025
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12405
Section • (3) The agency shall document all the following in the
Description child's record before a change of placement occurs:
• (c) If the child is not reunited with siblings or placed
with a relative, then the reason why those
placements are not possible.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The agency did not document the consideration of placement with
a relative.
Investigation During the investigation of R 400.12404 described above, the
agency initiated communication with Relative 1 on 01/17/2025.
The Foster Care Navigator was interviewed via telephone on
04/28/2025. Foster Care Navigator reported on 01/15/2025 she
received a telephone call from Relative 1 who was interested in
the placement of Foster Child A with her in North Carolina. Foster
Care Navigator reached out to Foster Care Supervisor and
reported Foster Care Supervisor responded to her email on
01/16/2025 asking for more clarifying information.
The agency Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed face to
face at the agency on 03/13/2025. Foster Care Supervisor
reported she contacted Relative 1 via phone on January 17, 2025.
Foster Care Supervisor reported she informed Relative 1 she
4

would begin the process of completing the ICPC packet and it
would be done by early February 2025.
Foster Care Supervisor reported to Relative 1 via text she would
complete the ICPC packet by 02/07/2025.
DOCUMENT REVIEW:
A social work contact dated 01/17/2025 documents the agency’s
consideration of Relative 1 becoming the placement home for
Foster Child A.
A 01/22/2025 text from the Foster Care Supervisor to Relative 1
provides an update for Relative 1.
Analysis Documentation indicates that the agency was considering the
placement of Foster Child A with Relative 1 and efforts were
underway for this until the case was transferred on 01/29/2025.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
